title: Almost a Lawyer
text: My only ambition for the first 20 years was to become a lawyer and own nice things. Then in my late teens I realized I care deeply about life around me — and in fact, in the entire universe. That was the end of the lawyer plan.

title: The Cause Rabbit Hole
text: Before AI diplomacy: animal rights, then effective altruism, then biosecurity policy at the Biological Weapons Convention. Each shift felt like a reinvention. Looking back, the thread was always the same — find the highest-leverage thing.

title: Snowboard Instructor
text: I used to be a certified snowboard instructor. There's something about teaching someone to carve their first turn that never gets old.

title: Aphantasia
text: I have no mental imagery. No inner voice. My long-term memory is purely semantic. I can't picture my mother's face or replay a song in my head. It makes me an unusual thinker — I process the world in abstractions, not images.

title: Ultimate Frisbee
text: Spirit of the Game > referees. Self-officiated competitive sport that actually works.

title: Laser Tag
text: Unironically one of my favorite activities. Peak coordination game.

title: Sauna
text: Regular sauna-goer. Heat stress as meditation.

title: Yoga + HIIT + Weights
text: I rotate between all three. Flexibility, cardio, strength — pick any two on a given week.

title: Biking
text: Primary mode of transport in Geneva. Car-free by choice.

title: Coordination Obsessive
text: Many problems in the world may be engineering problems, but once you've found one, you've got a coordination problem — and those are usually framing problems. Norms, trust, culture, how groups end up seeing the same thing. I think about this constantly.

title: Psychedelics
text: Psychedelics showed me that what we call "stable reality" is just the brain's best guess. On acid, all the categories fall apart and you see the uncategorized things — consciousness as the substrate beneath coordination.

title: Feedback Obsessive
text: I work with a coach, run 360-degree reviews, and think obsessively about how to give better feedback. Goals are instrumental. Growth is the permanent state. Comfort is the enemy of agency.

title: Google Reviews Evangelist
text: I write a lot of Google reviews because I think it's a public good. Good places deserve visibility, bad places deserve accountability, and shaming is good actually.

title: Exchange Student
text: Lived a year near Nashville through AFS when I was 15. Formative in ways I'm still unpacking.

title: Reading Champion
text: Won reading competitions in 5th grade. The obsession with consuming written ideas started early.

title: Forest Ranger's Housemate
text: Lived with a forest ranger for three years. Nature as roommate.

title: Musical Dabbler
text: Played drums and trumpet. Badly. The musical ambition eventually found its home in DJing.

title: World of Warcraft
text: Three years of intense WoW. My first real lesson in coordination, guild management, and why incentive structures matter more than intentions.

title: Trilingual Reader
text: Have read Lord of the Rings and Eragon each in three languages. Some books are worth experiencing in every tongue you have.

title: Ex-Vegan
text: Was vegan for three years but now think it's likely unhealthy for many people, and meat seems unfortunately integral to human nutrition. The solution isn't moral purity — it's accelerating lab-grown meat. Which means accelerating AI. Which means the path to fixing animal agriculture runs through the same tech stack as terraforming Earth.
